title: Mobile Device Usage App Prep
text:
###Load required packages

library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(janitor)


Attaching package: 'janitor'

The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    chisq.test, fisher.test


###Read in data set

user_behavior_dataset <-
  read_csv("user_behavior_dataset.csv") |>
  clean_names() |>
  mutate(across(c(device_model, operating_system, gender, user_behavior_class), as.factor)) |>
  mutate(user_id = as.character(user_id))

Rows: 700 Columns: 11
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (3): Device Model, Operating System, Gender
dbl (8): User ID, App Usage Time (min/day), Screen On Time (hours/day), Batt...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


##Numerical and graphical summaries
###One-way and two-way contingency tables

user_behavior_dataset |>
  group_by(device_model) |>
  summarise(count = n())

# A tibble: 5 × 2
  device_model       count
  <fct>              <int>
1 Google Pixel 5       142
2 iPhone 12            146
3 OnePlus 9            133
4 Samsung Galaxy S21   133
5 Xiaomi Mi 11         146



user_behavior_dataset |>
  group_by(device_model, gender) |>
  summarise(count = n()) |>
  pivot_wider(names_from = gender, values_from = count)

`summarise()` has grouped output by 'device_model'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.


# A tibble: 5 × 3
# Groups:   device_model [5]
  device_model       Female  Male
  <fct>               <int> <int>
1 Google Pixel 5         69    73
2 iPhone 12              74    72
3 OnePlus 9              61    72
4 Samsung Galaxy S21     54    79
5 Xiaomi Mi 11           78    68


###Numeric summaries (means, medians, sds, etc.) for quantitative variables at levels of categorical variables

user_behavior_dataset |>
  group_by(user_behavior_class) |>
  summarise(across(where(is.numeric),
                   list("mean" = mean, "median" = median, "stdev" = sd, "IQR" = IQR),
                   .names = "{.fn}_{.col}"))|>
  mutate(across(where(is.numeric), round, 2))

Warning: There was 1 warning in `mutate()`.
ℹ In argument: `across(where(is.numeric), round, 2)`.
Caused by warning:
! The `...` argument of `across()` is deprecated as of dplyr 1.1.0.
Supply arguments directly to `.fns` through an anonymous function instead.

  # Previously
  across(a:b, mean, na.rm = TRUE)

  # Now
  across(a:b, \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE))


# A tibble: 5 × 25
  user_behavior_class mean_app_usage_time_min_day median_app_usage_time_min_day
  <fct>                                     <dbl>                         <dbl>
1 1                                          60.4                           64 
2 2                                         132.                           132.
3 3                                         235.                           229 
4 4                                         396.                           405 
5 5                                         541.                           540 
# ℹ 22 more variables: stdev_app_usage_time_min_day <dbl>,
#   IQR_app_usage_time_min_day <dbl>, mean_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   median_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   stdev_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>, IQR_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   mean_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>, median_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>,
#   stdev_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>, IQR_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>,
#   mean_number_of_apps_installed <dbl>, …



user_behavior_dataset |>
  group_by(gender) |>
  summarise(across(where(is.numeric),
                   list("mean" = mean, "median" = median, "stdev" = sd, "IQR" = IQR),
                   .names = "{.fn}_{.col}"))|>
  mutate(across(where(is.numeric), round, 2))

# A tibble: 2 × 25
  gender mean_app_usage_time_min…¹ median_app_usage_tim…² stdev_app_usage_time…³
  <fct>                      <dbl>                  <dbl>                  <dbl>
1 Female                      272.                    230                   174.
2 Male                        270.                    222                   180.
# ℹ abbreviated names: ¹​mean_app_usage_time_min_day,
#   ²​median_app_usage_time_min_day, ³​stdev_app_usage_time_min_day
# ℹ 21 more variables: IQR_app_usage_time_min_day <dbl>,
#   mean_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>, median_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   stdev_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>, IQR_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   mean_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>, median_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>,
#   stdev_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>, IQR_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>, …



user_behavior_dataset |>
  group_by(device_model) |>
  summarise(across(where(is.numeric),
                   list("mean" = mean, "median" = median, "stdev" = sd, "IQR" = IQR),
                   .names = "{.fn}_{.col}"))|>
  mutate(across(where(is.numeric), round, 2))

# A tibble: 5 × 25
  device_model       mean_app_usage_time_min_day median_app_usage_time_min_day
  <fct>                                    <dbl>                         <dbl>
1 Google Pixel 5                            268.                          232.
2 iPhone 12                                 282.                          258.
3 OnePlus 9                                 270.                          216 
4 Samsung Galaxy S21                        266.                          217 
5 Xiaomi Mi 11                              268.                          217 
# ℹ 22 more variables: stdev_app_usage_time_min_day <dbl>,
#   IQR_app_usage_time_min_day <dbl>, mean_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   median_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   stdev_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>, IQR_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   mean_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>, median_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>,
#   stdev_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>, IQR_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>,
#   mean_number_of_apps_installed <dbl>, …



user_behavior_dataset |>
  group_by(operating_system) |>
  summarise(across(where(is.numeric),
                   list("mean" = mean, "median" = median, "stdev" = sd, "IQR" = IQR),
                   .names = "{.fn}_{.col}"))|>
  mutate(across(where(is.numeric), round, 2))

# A tibble: 2 × 25
  operating_system mean_app_usage_time_min_day median_app_usage_time_min_day
  <fct>                                  <dbl>                         <dbl>
1 Android                                 268.                          225 
2 iOS                                     282.                          258.
# ℹ 22 more variables: stdev_app_usage_time_min_day <dbl>,
#   IQR_app_usage_time_min_day <dbl>, mean_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   median_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   stdev_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>, IQR_screen_on_time_hours_day <dbl>,
#   mean_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>, median_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>,
#   stdev_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>, IQR_battery_drain_m_ah_day <dbl>,
#   mean_number_of_apps_installed <dbl>, …



user_behavior_dataset |>
  ggplot(aes(x = user_behavior_class, fill = device_model)) +
  geom_bar() +
  xlab("User Behavior Class") +
  ylab("Count") +
  labs(fill = "Device Model") +
  ggtitle("Device Models by User Behavior Class") +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette="Spectral")









user_behavior_dataset |>
  ggplot(aes(x = gender, fill = user_behavior_class)) +
  geom_bar(position = "dodge") +
  xlab("Gender") +
  ylab("Count") +
  labs(fill = "User Behavior Class") +
  ggtitle("User Behavior Class by Gender") +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette="Spectral")
